reviewText: This funny movie is suitable for all audiences.  Though a bit of the humor is forced and predicable, I found that I didn't care.  The two dogs and the two inept "bad" guys make the movie an enjoyable romp from start to finish.  Anyone young at heart, who still has some youthful innocence will be able to go along with the action and have a ball of a time.

We found this video in our public library and my boys think it is hilarious!  They have watched it over and over.  It's not as interesting for adults, but for elementary age kids, it's a winner!

There are a few "scary" moments when the boy is kidnapped...but the dogs find him and rescue him with great escapades.  Of course it's unrealistic, but that is what makes it funny.

Overall it's a great kids movie with the "Home Alone" feel to it.
An interesting, but not too funny type of comedy. To commit viewing this flick from start to finish, is a challenge
In the mold of the Home Alone series, but with twice the dogs, twice the villains, and half the fun. The kidnapped boy is a total dud. Generally, the acting is pretty pathetic. 1 3/4 stars
Great family movie
Fun
Very entertaining movie! Especially if you like animals!
very cute movie
Absolute nonsense from start to finish. Nothing in this movie makes sense. Nothing. The reason I liked it is because it showcases the things dogs can be trained to do.
These dogs love their family
Cute movie I really enjoyed it!!

Very cute (however very unrealistic as wel but . .. ) - one wonders how these little dogs are able to perform all that they actually did.  Amazing!!! Stupid (of course) men who tried to outwit them made it funnier too.
It was cute....liked it.

Did you love the scenes in Home Alone where McCauley Culkin set traps for the stupid crooks who broke into his home?

If so, you'll love all the traps that these dogs set for the kidnappers who come into their home after kidnapping his young master.

A delightful film that the entire family can enjoy.
I found it to be very entertaining and funny.
Cute dogs, otherwise low budget disaster.
Some parts are very funny, reminiscent of Home Alone movies. It was definitely made for children.
cute but cheesy!
Love this movie.  Was very entertaining and funny! Those dogs were great!  Great movie for the whole family
Low quality film, which was difficult to watch on a HD TV.  It felt like it should have been an after school weekday movie.
Cute!
Slap stick "home alone" movie with animals.  Kids would love.
Good movie great service
Dogs or great, dialog not so much. Probably targeted for very young children.
It was a cute movie.  My granddaughter wanted to give it five stars
who ever calls on Jesus will be saved..
Very good
A cute take off on HOME ALONE, but the Dogs are the ones to save the day...
Love it great family show
Good family movie

When a young boy is taken hostage by two idiot kidnappers, the boy's two dogs must jump into action to thwart the kidnappers and rescue the boy.  This movie will appeal to mainly to kids, but most adults will likely enjoy it as well.  The acting is a little weak, and the plot is a little  far-fetched at times, but overall the movie was enjoyable.  If you liked "Home Alone", you will probably like this.
This was a very cute movie. My grandkids loves it. They are 6 and 3 1/2
My daughter enjoyed it. Acting is weak though.
Very ordinary, even the kids were reluctant to laugh at some of the antics
Definitely not worth watching!  My kids didn't seem to mind, but terrible acting and not very entertaining.

A simple knockoff of the hi-jinks of Home Alone - with dogs foiling the bad guys. Acting is not very good, plot is simple-minded and very predictable,  I didn't like it but my grandchildren, ages 4 and 8, got a lot of laughs from it. But for the grandchildren, I would have given it 2 stars.
Lovely. My kids love them.
Bad acting.  Only a five year old could be somewhat impressed.
This is one of my all time favorite movies, the criminals are hilarious, the dogs are the saviors and little Charlie is the innocent child being used against his family. Definitely a must own movie!
This was what too funny. Enjoyed every minute of it.
best
Very silly the bad guys, very fun to watch the 2 dogs!!!!
i hope my son gets a dogs like these two heros
Just an enjoyable movie to watch.
Adorable animals, funny, good movie.
Only watched the first few minutes. Pretty lame.
Really nice movie; sometimes funny and always delightful to watch.  Highly recommend.
If I were a 6-year-old, this would be 5 stars.  It needs to be known that this is for young (real young) folks.
The story is a little funny, and it is very family friendly, so I very much appreciate that and support those who produce movies that are clean.
Wonder movie.  Started watching with grandkids.  Hubby and I finished watch when they left.  Love this movie.
smart dogs
Great for kids
Nice to buy good and cheap movies.
Cute.  A good story for children.
It's adorable. Funny, cute. I love the two furry stars.
love it its like a dog version of home alone

-I loved it.  I am 84 years old  and seem to be going into that childhood they talk about. My grandchildren are grown and my great grandchildren live across country and I DREAM of them sitting with me at my fathers house , who loved his dogs, and watching and laughing through the who picture.
It is great and I will watch it again as soon as I round up some children.
If you like the home alone movies ..you will love this movie. In my opinion this movie is better than home alone...

Can't wait for my great-grandchildren to come & visit me this summer so I can show them this movie--they will just love it! They all love dogs and cats and funny movies involving either pet so I know how much they will enjoy this. Like others have commented, this story reminds me of Home Alone but just with dogs instead of a little boy.

Update: My 2 great-grandchildren have came for a visit since I originally posted the above and we had a very enjoyable time watching this movie. Now my 7 year old great-granddaughter is ADD--hyperactive, but even she was able to sit and watch this movie--it kept her attention for the whole movie. I highly recommend this movie to anyone who has small children, but I think children of all ages will enjoy this comedy.
I'm always warmed by canine family-oriented coming of age stories.  These little guys really kicked butt.  I had a lot of fun.
Great movie.  My dog loved it.
My child appreciated the movie - he is 10.

Kudos to whoever the dog choreographer and trainers were.  If you love dogs the dog acting makes this worthwhile all by itself.  I even found myself laughing out loud a couple times.  Also, now I think I want to watch Home Alone and Milo and Otis.
GOOD FAMILY MOVIE AND THE DOG'S MADE IT FUNNY !!!!!!

Little Heroes is adorable!  Love the dogs!!!  The story is predictable but very entertaining.
I would recommend to all ages.
Great movie for the kids.  A little painful for adults to watch.  My kids enjoyed it immensely - especially the 9 yr old.
Good humor in both and animals and the character s.f
Great movie
My daughter is 8 and an avid Dog Lover, this movie did not disappoint.
My 7,5 and 3 Year olds thought it was Hilarious.  For me odd story line, cheaply made and far fetched scenes.  But the Boys thoroughly enjoyed it great movie for children.

This is a great movie. The training that must have gone into for these two dogs
to perform as they did is phenomonial! After watching the move which kind of
reminded me of the movie "Home Alone" be sure to view the bonus feature
entitled, "Dogs are People Too:. They show five outstanding canines and I
would rate this bonus feature almost as high as the m,ovie itself.
my kids ages 9,8,6 and 4 loved it  ! parents thought it was safe and clean and funny. dogs were super cute
My kids, ages 5, 7, 9, 11, & 13, loved this movie. Laughed all through it. It is like a Home Alone, but dogs are the ones setting up the traps.
My son really liked this movie! It was kind of silly and not great for adult entertainment but great for kids!
If you are in a mood for just a sweet Doggy story... this is it... kind of based on the Home Alone type antics....

Cute, well trained dogs.  Not so well trained humans, but (except for the criminals) not hopeless.  The criminals were totally out of it.  Absolutely hysterical!  A nice movie when you want something brainless.
My son used this for a book report!  Awesome story and wholesome reading which is getting  harder to find now days!

I have 7 grandchildren ages 3-13 & they all love it.  We watch it often when they come over & they laugh at all
the silly things the kidnappers do.  Great family movie.

The movie was a bit sophmoric.  Weak plot, so,so acting.

Probably fine taking into account the intended audience, a very young audience.

Adults, likely, will suffer through it

I'd say they "hit their target audience." It's a little like "Home Alone" with two dogs as the heroes! Silly, slapstick fun.
There is a kidnapping as the inciting incident for the plot, so be forewarned your child will be exposed/introduced to that.
I bought this as a gift for my niece who is 10 yrs old and she loves it! If you or someone you know love dogs they with love this movie!
This movie may have been around a while, but the kids love it. The canines steal the show! Try it!

I watched this movie with my Grandma last night because she thought it looked cute.

I will admit, the dogs were very well trained...but that's as far as it goes. I work with dogs all the time, and most of the dogs I know get confused if they walk on the wrong side of the tree with a leash on. There is no way a dog knows what olive oil is, or flour, or understand the premise of a exhaust pipe on a car.

And seriously, how slow was that car driving for those dogs to be able to keep up? Ten miles an hour??? With tens of thousands of dollars on the line, they sure don't seem to be in a hurry. I understand this is a kid's movie, but the behavior of the dogs was so blatantly absurd and unbelievable. A movie like Homeward Bound might give the dogs human personalities, but they still behave like dogs! The dogs in this movie launch such a better-ordered scheme than most humans would in the same circumstances.

Honestly, this movie was incredibly boring. Maybe an eight-year-old would like it, but there isn't any substance to the plot. Some of the banter between the two hired men was enjoyable, but that's as far as it went. I wish I had these two hours of my life back. Don't watch it unless you have little kids, or you will regret it.

This made-for-tv movie is between a 2 to 3 rating.  Younger kids or senior citizens would rate it a 3, but older kids to middle age will rate this a 2 or lower.  The problem is the movie starts out okay, but then it goes into slap stick comedy in which the thugs get stupid while the dogs save the day.

The story is that the father is an ex-executive of a tobacco company and is about to testify against the tobacco industry, and he decides to take his wife with him to Washington DC for the senate hearing.  However, he leaves his little son home (around 8 years old) with his two dogs and a maid.  The tobacco company sends two thugs to the house to kidnap the kid and a few thugs to warn the parents that if they testify, their kid would be hurt.  Well, during the kidnapping, the two thugs are overwhelmed by the two dogs that seem to figured out how to cause these two dumb thugs to fall down the stairs or crash into the wall, etc.  This is a mindless movie that can be entertaining to someone who just wants to see silly things happen to these two thugs.  Due to the thugs having to act stupid, their acting performance became really poor and annoying at times.  The dogs did okay, but they really didn't do anything super impressive.
Slapstick but really cute adventure.  Dogs were amazingly trained!!

"Home Alone" with two dogs that are far more intelligent than the human characters sharing the screen.  This movie is so bad it should be hilarious, but it just falls completely flat.  The only thing good I can say about this movie is that your dogs might enjoy watching the other dogs running around onscreen.

Dogs are adorable, little kid cute when he isn't under or in a burlap bag, gagged and tied (yes, he spends a substantial amount of the movie this way.)

You know the movie is bad when the dogs are better actors than the humans, but the humans get more screen time.

If the dogs were featured more, the movie would have been so much better but alas, they weren't given that opportunity. Have to say I'm shocked that reviews here have recommended this for...kids? The dogs are threatened (in words) with being killed, microwaved, put in an oven (I'm serious) and the kid is manhandled, threatened, bound and gagged and the maid is too! Wow, not exactly my idea of family fun. The dogs ARE little heroes for appearing in this mess imo.
thank you
I love the movie because the dogs knew just what to do, and when. They were great characters.
darling movie of smart dogs great for adults and kids too
Very good family movie. Very entertaining.
Home alone with dogs....kids will love it!
Hilarious!  If you like the "Home Alone" movies, you will like this.
